SEARCH
Package game

Class Move

java.lang.Object
game.Move
public class Move extends Object
The Move class handles the generation of valid moves for Backgammon checkers based on dice rolls. It provides methods for determining valid moves, handling bear-off moves, generating moves for the same dice roll, and managing the state of the game board during moves.

  • Method Details

    • isBearOff

      public boolean isBearOff(Triangle.Checker checker)
      Checks if a move involves bearing off checkers.
      Parameters:
      checker - The Checker type representing the current player.
      Returns:
      True if the move involves bearing off, false otherwise.

    • generateSameDiceRollMoves

      public void generateSameDiceRollMoves(Point[] points, int roll1, boolean isBearOff)
      Generates moves for the same dice roll and adds them to the map.
      Parameters:
      points - The array of Point objects representing the game board.
      roll1 - The value of the dice roll.
      isBearOff - A boolean indicating whether the move involves bearing off.

    • getBearOffMoves

      public void getBearOffMoves(Point[] points, int roll1, int roll2)
      Generates bear-off moves and adds them to the map.
      Parameters:
      points - The array of Point objects representing the game board.
      roll1 - The value of the first dice roll.
      roll2 - The value of the second dice roll.

    • getMoves

      public HashMap<Integer,ArrayList<ArrayList<Integer>>> getMoves(Triangle.Checker checker, Point[] points, int roll1, int roll2)
      Generates all possible moves for a given dice roll configuration.
      Parameters:
      checker - The Checker type representing the current player.
      points - The array of Point objects representing the game board.
      roll1 - The value of the first dice roll.
      roll2 - The value of the second dice roll.
      Returns:
      A HashMap containing the generated moves.

    • isValidMove

      public boolean isValidMove(Point[] points, int position, int roll)
      Checks if a move is valid based on the current game state.
      Parameters:
      points - The array of Point objects representing the game board.
      position - The starting position of the move.
      roll - The value of the dice roll for the move.
      Returns:
      True if the move is valid, false otherwise.

    • areBarsClearable

      public boolean areBarsClearable(int position)
      Checks if checkers can be cleared from the bar during a move.
      Parameters:
      position - The position where the move is initiated.
      Returns:
      True if checkers can be cleared from the bar, false otherwise.

    • isValidMove

      public boolean isValidMove(Point[] points, int firstPoint, int roll1, int secondPoint, int roll2)
      Checks if a move involving two points is valid based on the current game state.
      Parameters:
      points - The array of Point objects representing the game board.
      firstPoint - The starting position of the first move.
      roll1 - The value of the dice roll for the first move.
      secondPoint - The starting position of the second move.
      roll2 - The value of the dice roll for the second move.
      Returns:
      True if the move is valid, false otherwise.

    • makeMove

      public void makeMove(Point[] points, int start, int end, Triangle.Checker checker)
      Executes a move on the game board, updating the board state.
      Parameters:
      points - The array of Point objects representing the game board.
      start - The starting position of the move.
      end - The ending position of the move. If -1, it indicates a bear-off move.
      checker - The Checker type representing the current player.
